title: Frank Lampard's trophy-laden career remembered in Topps Cards after Chelsea legend hangs up his boots
text:
Frank Lampard won Premier Leagues, Champions Leagues and plenty more (Photo: Getty) Share Get Chelsea FC   
Frank Lampard brought the curtain down on his playing career on Thursday when he announced his retirement. 
And what better way to remember him through the ages than with a selection of Frank Lampard Topps Cards? 
The 38-year-old played his last game of football in New York but it will be his time in the Premier League that for which he is most fondly remembered. 
After getting his start in West Ham's youth team set up, the cultured midfielder enjoyed the best years of his career at Stamford Bridge with Chelsea, where he set all kinds of records for the club, before a brief stint with Manchester City. 
He may be famed for his consistency, but as you can see in the tweet below, the England midfielder changed his style several times throughout his career and he also made a seemingly conscious decision at some point to stop smiling in photos. Read More Frank Lampard or Steven Gerrard? Our reporters answer the question that plagued both England legends' careers West Ham 
Lampard started his long and successful career in east London and was promoted to the Hammers senior squad at the age of 17 in 1995. 
At West Ham, Lampard made 148 appearances scoring 24 goals and in 1999, he won the UEFA Intertoto Cup - his first trophy as a senior player. 
By the time Lampard had reached the age of 23, his time at West Ham had come to an end and he crossed London to join Chelsea in an Â£11million move in 2001. Lampard broke through at West Ham as a fresh-faced teen under Harry Redknapp's tutelage Chelsea 
It was at Stamford Bridge that the Englishman flourished and where he produced his best football. 
In total Lampard won 13 trophies over his 13 years at the club and in the 2004/05 season, the midfielder won his first ever Premier League title with the club, as well as the League Cup. 
He went on to win a second successive league title, but that was only the beginning. 
In the 2006/07 season, the Chelsea man won his first FA Cup with the club in which he was awarded man of the match in the final, and in the same season he won another League Cup.
